2. Prader-Willi syndrome: This is a genetic disorder characterized by a combination of symptoms including low muscle tone, short stature, obesity, and cognitive impairment. It is caused by the deletion or malfunctioning of certain genes on the paternal chromosome 15.
3. Translocation: This term refers to the abnormal attachment or transfer of a segment of genetic material from one chromosome to another chromosome. In this context, it is mentioned that the translocation involves chromosomes 3 and 15.
